      • setup

        public void setup(logist.topology.Topology topology,
                  logist.task.TaskDistribution td,
                  logist.agent.Agent agent)
        The setup method is called exactly once, before the simulation starts and before any other method is called. The agent argument can be used to access important properties of the agent.
        Specified by:
        setup in interface logist.behavior.ReactiveBehavior

      • act

        public logist.plan.Action act(logist.simulation.Vehicle vehicle,
                              logist.task.Task availableTask)
        This method is called every time the agent arrives in a new city and is not carrying a task. The agent can see at most one available task in the city and has to decide whether or not to accept the task. It is possible that there is no task in which case availableTask is null. • If the agent decides to pick up the task, the platform will take over the control of the vehicle and deliver the task on the shortest path. The next time this method is called the vehicle will have dropped the task at its destination. • If the agent decides to refuse the task, it chooses a neighboring city to move to. A refused task disappears and will not be available the next time the agent visits the city. Note: If multiple tasks are available then the LogistPlatform randomly selects the task that is shown to the agent. If no task is available then the agent must return a move action.
        Specified by:
        act in interface logist.behavior.ReactiveBehavior
        Parameters:
        vehicle - - our reactive agent
        availableTask - - task in the city, can be null
        Returns:
        action - whether the task was picked up or it left it in the city

      • Best

        private RouteAction Best(RouteState state)
        From the policy (strategy) table, it finds the best action to do when the agent is in state `state`.
        Parameters:
        state - - State for which we want to get the best action
        Returns:
        - action that is best to do in this state

      • rla

        public void rla()
        Performing a Reinforcement Learning Algorithm for construction of the policy (strategy) that will help us decide what is the best action to do in any state that we get into. The algorithm follows the structure of `value iteration` algorithm. First, we fill in the Q-table (column=state, row=action). Then we find the max value of each column in Q-table and that max value corresponds to the best action that can be performed in that state. We loop until it is good enough. Good enough in our case means that the difference between 2 successive iterations is smaller than some epsilon we defined above.

      • discountedSum

        public double discountedSum(RouteState state,
                            RouteAction action)
        Calculate discounted future. Discount is the gamma in the algorithm of `value iteration`. This transition is also the probability that we get to any state, say `state0` given that we are currently in state `state` and implement action `action`.
        Parameters:
        state - - state from which the transition happens
        action - - action we do in the state
        Returns:
        sum - discounted sum, i.e. discounted future effect on the value of state

      • transition

        public double transition(RouteState state,
                         RouteAction action,
                         RouteState state0)
        Transition from state `state` with action `action` to state `state0`. This transition is also represented as the probability to get into state `state0` given we are in the state `state` and perform action `action`.
        Parameters:
        state - - Transition from this state
        action - - Action that initiates transition
        state0 - - Transition to this state
        Returns:
        probability - Probability we get into state `state0` when in state `state` we perform the action `action`.

      • goodEnough

        public boolean goodEnough(java.util.HashMap<RouteState,ActionValue<RouteAction>> v0,
                          java.util.HashMap<RouteState,ActionValue<RouteAction>> v)
        Condition that says if the algorithm is good enough. It calculates the difference between two successive iterations of Value of State vectors V.
        Parameters:
        v0 - - Previous iteration value of Value of State vector.
        v - - Current iteration value of Value of State vector.
        Returns:
        true - if it is good enough, false - if it is not yet good enough.
